Articles.Content:
KSC is an awesome place to tour around. But, what if you could work there?

If you could choose where you would like to be employed at the KSC as an intern doing mundane work.

Which team?

Which facility?

What mundane task will be preformed?

Why you want to work there?

Alternative choice?

For me its the

Tracking Centre Complex

Working at the East dish.

Locating and removing only the 1/4W 22k resistors from burnt trash PCB's.

So I have time to see it coming.

Wind Tunnel.

Edited October 17, 2014 by MoeslyArmlis
clarity

Which team?

The smart one.

Which facility?

As far from the fuel tanks as kermanly possible.

Which mundane task will be performed?

Programming the computers to not crash... because that's the pilots job.

Which team?

flying team!

Which facility?

VAB and SPH or is it Astronaut complex?

What mundane task will be preformed?

shooting down other rockets launching with my planes using andrew's missiles....flying to minmus and taking a scoop for my ice cream....hanging out with jeb

As me, or as a Kerbal?

If I'd have to chose as me, I'd stay as far away from KSC as possible. Way to many explosions.

If as a Kerbal, SCIENCE!
Me ? Biochemistry team to go to Laythe , to find what the hell is producing that oxygen
The strut team. I'll be using duct tape specially.
the driver of that truck that veers around when you are in the vab
The one that developes the rockets in the VAB and runs around with lab coats and clipboards of course

the driver of that truck that veers around when you are in the vab

Ah! Have meh rep!

I was going to say that too... Although, which one? The long one, or the one that nearly hits the long one?

(I'd be the daredevil fellow who almost hits the other guy )

VAB.

Space Tape Application Specialist.

If the space program is being run by someone like myself, then I want to go to space. Surely there's an intern position on some mission or other, perhaps at the LKO station where I can prove myself worthy of a bigger mission. I know I can depend on the forces that be to turn back time if anything goes wrong.
Member of the Subcommittee on Kraken Research and Anti-Kraken Weapons Development

The one that developes the rockets in the VAB and runs around with lab coats and clipboards of course

Me too. You know they are ghosts of Kerbals past don't you. That walk through engines and can't die again. You could watch launches from the pad with no fear.

Depends on who runs the space program. If it's mine, definitely would work in the VAB as a part of the ground crew that stands around waving those batons pointlessly. If it's Scott Manley's, I'd be off working in the Astronaut Complex as the guy who keeps the computers running (and makes sure that Shepman'); DROP TABLE Recruits;-- Kerman doesn't get added to the roster... again). If it's Danny2462's space program, off-site evacuation drill sergeant... at a completely different space center.
I'll be in charge of buying moar boosters
Polishing separatrons for Jeb

Which team?

flying team!

Which facility?

VAB and SPH or is it Astronaut complex?

What mundane task will be preformed?

shooting down other rockets launching with my planes using andrew's missiles....flying to minmus and taking a scoop for my ice cream....hanging out with jeb

The team here has had time to review your application.

While shooting down other rockets and going to Minmus is exciting. It is best left for the trained pilots.

It seems you want to apply to the KSC Explosive Tasks Intern Program. We have transferred your application to the appropriate place.

Sorry that you have been disqualified from this KSC intern application pool. Please try again later.

Respectfully,

Moe

Edited October 17, 2014 by MoeslyArmlis

the driver of that truck that veers around when you are in the vab

We here at Kerbal Science Center takes the spunk out of a new intern. Then we grind and mould them into a shiny new pilot.

Unfortunately the KSC Fleet Vehicles Team are much to busy repairing vehicles then to look after an intern.

The Fuel Enrichment team, however, always needs interns with lotsa spunk. So, if you decide to undergo an internship here at the KSC, we would like to welcome you to join the Fuel Enrichment Team. Please report to the SPH Round Fuel Tank and the Fuel Enrichment Steeping process will be further explained.

p.s.

You don't have a fear of being dangled from a rope do you?

Truly,

Moe
Nuclear Engine Risk Manager, KSP Occupational Health & Safety Department.
Definitely the snack bar. I would want to work the snack bar, especially once they let all the female Kerbals in!

Definitely the snack bar. I would want to work the snack bar, especially once they let all the female Kerbals in!

What? Is this what I think it means?

We here at Kerbal Science Center takes the spunk out of a new intern. Then we grind and mould them into a shiny new pilot.

Unfortunately the KSC Fleet Vehicles Team are much to busy repairing vehicles then to look after an intern.

The Fuel Enrichment team, however, always needs interns with lotsa spunk. So, if you decide to undergo an internship here at the KSC, we would like to welcome you to join the Fuel Enrichment Team. Please report to the SPH Round Fuel Tank and the Fuel Enrichment Steeping process will be further explained.

p.s.

You don't have a fear of being dangled from a rope do you?

Truly,

Moe

You're not driving that truck in the space plane hangar that's doing "Tokyo Drift" below your spaceplane? Seriously watch for that one truck that power slides across the SPH.

As for me:

Team: Operations

Location: Vehicle assembly building

Mundane task: Programming the stage separations in the computer

Why: Cause the other guy keeps putting the launch clamp in the wrong stage.

Alternative choice: R&D making the logical connection between how the temperature on the mun relates to being able to build a new rocket part (it doesn't make a lot of sense until you stare at it for hours).

What? Is this what I think it means?

No. By no means am I implying that female Kerbals are imminent. I just mean that I want to get my foot in the snack bar door before they do arrive.

Which team?

The smart one.

Which facility?

As far from the fuel tanks as kermanly possible.

Which mundane task will be performed?

Programming the computers to not crash... because that's the pilots job.

The KSC Computer Lab had a great need for prospective intrerns last year. They were tasked to switch the semicolons with colons. Since we program only on the finest fibrous documents, that meant alot of rubbing out and keeping the inscriptors sharp.

This year Mortimer has a strategy to save Funds and needs interns. Congratulations on being selected for the Document Fastener Recycling Program. These metallalic fasteners are from the shredded remains of used RT-10 casings and therefore extremely expensive.

If you decide to take this position please report to the Administration Building where you will begin your task of removing, straighting, and reshaping.

Great. So, if you could just get to that as soon as possible that would be terrific. Mkay. Thanks a bunch, Alshain.

Warmly,

Moe

Edited November 30, 2014 by MoeslyArmlis

Which team?

Commander Jeb's team of epic space ship people.

Which facility?

Jeb's space dock thingy

What mundane task will be preformed?

making commander Jeb's chair go up down and spin around.

Why you want to work there?

to watch epic missions from orbit.

Alternative choice?

pushing space trains to the limit, or any staff on Jebsy Danger
